summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) contractors and staff discussing the technical logistics of uploading and producing discovery materials (specifically from Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan) to Ghislaine Maxwell, who was incarcerated at MDC. The focus is on file formats, confidentiality stamps, and production methods.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case and the intended recipient of the discovery production. The emails discuss producing files to her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Discovery Production Planning for Maxwell
events.description: A series of emails among SDNY contractors coordinating the upload, stamping, and production of approximately 40,000 files (300GB) from Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan for the Epstein/Maxwell case to be provided to the defense.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing discovery production in the Maxwell case as of September 2020, involving financial records from Deutsche Bank and JPMorgan.
Approximately 40,000 files (300GB) of seized images and data needed to be processed, stamped as confidential, and produced to Maxwell in custody.
The production involved technical challenges, including converting native Excel and text files for delivery to the detention center and applying confidentiality stamps.
The email chain is between contractors and staff for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating the scale of the prosecution's document management.
